result.execSummary:
The defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

No consumption/possession of alcohol.

No entry into any bars/taverns.

No contact with Marcus Morris except for what is needed for the family case.
Take all medication as prescribed by treating physician or medical care provider and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week.

supervisions.notes: Huber and good time allowed. Eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

All other conditions the same as count 1 with no additional community service or jail time.
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:55 pm. Here on defendant's motion to be released for huber for child care. Court questions defendant. Court questions the defendants mother. State makes statement to what the situation is at the present time. Court requiring that if grandmother is working that mother should be released to care for the child. The grandmother can call the Sheriff and notify him of days that she would be working. Court clarifies that it is ultimate decision of the Sheriff regarding if defendant is going to be released for Huber purposes.
Motion hearing on October 12, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
from DE to court re: huber for day care - set for hearing

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:35 AM. Lynch has revocation packet and does not see any errors or ommissions. State believes there is an ommission, packet only states one conviction but she was convited of two counts. State - comes up with 180 days and Lynch comes up with 181 days credit - will stipulate to 181 days credit - have complied with victim notification requirements - recommends 1 year in FC jail on each count - consecutive to each other - makes argument for that. Lynch makes final argument prior to recommendations - reommends 7 months in couty jail on each count - concurrent to each other - with credit for 181 days. Bradley makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - 1 year in FC county jail on each count - consecutive to each other - credit for 181 days - huber and good time allowed - eligible for commmunity service under 973.03(3), right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 27, 2017 at 11:00 am.
45 days added as a condition of probation

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:05 AM. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements and victim is in the courtroom and would like to make a statement and has provided Court and counsel with VIS statement - defendant would plead g/nc to counts #1 and #2, #3 - DRI, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 2 years on both counts, costs on each count, #1 - 30 days jail, AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession or entry, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by treating physician or medical care provider, $160.00 restitution plus $16.00 VW surchage totaling $176.00. Voorhees and Bradley agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #3 and explains what that means. Bradley pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freel, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Voorhees makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Bradley makes statement. Victim makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: costs on each count - 60 DTP commencing upon release from incarceration/CO, restitution of $176.00 with VW surcharge to KJ - 60 DTP commencing upon release from incarceration/CO, count #1 only - 30 days in FC jail - huber allowed - credit for 13 days only if revoked (stipulated) - report today, AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting each week, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by treating physician or medical care provider and in the manner in which they are prescribed, no contact whatsoever with Marcus Morris except for what is needed for the family case, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Jury trial on December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney .  Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in custody who appears via video froom FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:05 PM. State - believes the defendant is on a P&P hold and not on this matter. Voorhees - not resolved - State has made an offer, has gone over the plea offer with the defendant but has not gone over Frye with her. Court goes thru Frye with the defendant. Court continues bond, sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No consumption of alcohol, no contact with victim (KJ), keep Court advised of any address changes.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in custody and apperas via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:28 AM. Voorhees has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, sets for FPT. Voorhees - bond - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections as long as her mother (TB) is willing to house her. Court - bond - $500.00 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol, no contact with victim (KJ), keep Court advised of any address changes.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:11 AM. Bradley does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bradley understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney. Court refers to SPD. Court continues bond, sets for AIA. Defendant states she is no longer on a P&P hold. State wants bond continued. Court continues bond. Bradley argues for signature bond. Court continues cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.
